entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 14 at 2:11PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM AKST TUESDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect from 10 PM this evening to 2 PM AKST Tuesday. Fairbanks has a Stage 1 alert.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 14 at 12:47PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Tuesday evening through Thursday... Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 60 mph will cause elevated water levels and high surf along the coast from Point Hope to Utqiagvik Tuesday night through Thursday. Minor coastal flooding is also possible with waves 2 to 4 feet above the normal high tide line. Beach erosion is also possible.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 15 at 8:49AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor is forecast to remain near steady level the remainder of this week. However, residents will continue to see Moderate Flood impacts for the foreseeable future. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Moderate flooding is

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 15 at 8:46AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at DeLand is forecast to remain within Moderate Flood Stage this week with little change in level. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Moderate flooding impacts for the foreseeable future.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 15 at 8:43AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to slowly rise through Minor Flood Stage and approach Moderate Flood Stage by Wednesday as rainfall from Nicole moves through the basin. Residents and interests along the river should be prepared for near Moderate flood

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 15 at 8:42AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River above Lake Harney will remain within Moderate flood stage through the week with a very slow decline. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Moderate flooding impacts through this week.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 15 at 11:32AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hazardous Driving Conditions Possible With Snow Showers Across Southeast Wisconsin... Snow Showers with intermittent higher snowfall rates will continue to fall across portions of southeast Wisconsin through 3 PM. These snow showers may leave a slushy accumulation on roadways, especially bridges and overpasses. Widespread travel

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 15 at 11:04AM CST until November 16 at 4:00AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW EXPECTED OVER NORTHEAST WISCONSIN TONIGHT... .An upper level disturbance will produce light snow across the area through the afternoon hours. Then a band of lake effect snow will move south across the region tonight and bring a period of moderate to heavy snow. Two to four inches are expected in most places. Local amounts to six inches are possible.
